benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

covered: POST Valid Payload: Tests TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, and TC10 cover creation with valid payloads, including an empty array and multiple objects.
Invalid Payload: Tests TC08 (malformed JSON) and TC09 (missing request body) validate proper 400 responses.
Header/Authorization Handling: Tests TC07 (missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy) and TC12 (unauthorized access) address authorization scenarios.
Existence/ID Validation: Tests TC05 (non-existent invoice item) and TC06 (invalid UUID format) ensure 404/400 handling for bad IDs.
Large Payloads: TC14 examines large payload handling with 201 or 413 depending on limits.
Validation and Edge Cases: TC19 (lengths), TC20 (special characters), and TC21 (injection attempts) cover input validation and resilience.
Concurrency: TC16 tests concurrent POSTs to the same item and observes outcomes.
Integration/Persistence: TC18 verifies persistence by performing a GET after POST to retrieve created fields.
System State Variation: TC22, TC23, TC24, and TC25 cover empty DB, partial data, degraded performance, and network interruptions.
Unknown/Extra Fields: TC11 explores extra/unknown fields handling (ignored or error) and TC17 tests duplicate field names in payload.
gaps: Rate Limiting/Throttling tests are not present (no explicit tests for how the API behaves under bursty or rapid successive requests).
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache invalidation.
Additional 500-level server errors: Only 503 is tested; no dedicated tests for 500/502/504 error scenarios.
Explicit idempotency tests: No dedicated test ensuring repeated identical POSTs do not cause unintended duplicates (beyond field-level duplicates).
GET-related pagination or parameterized queries: While TC18 covers a GET after POST, there are no tests for pagination, filtering, or query parameters on retrieval of custom fields.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify behavior under high request volume and ensure proper responses, back-off, or throttling.
Introduce tests for caching semantics (ETag/Cache-Control) and cache invalidation on updates.
Add dedicated tests for additional 500-level server errors (e.g., 500 Internal Server Error) to improve resilience coverage.
Include explicit idempotency tests to ensure repeated identical POST requests are handled deterministically (no unintended duplicates).
Consider adding GET retrieval tests with pagination/filtering for listing custom fields if applicable to the API design.
